50 g of the powder of the aerial part of Thymus leptobotrys is placed in a cartridge and placed in the Soxhlet extractor [ 18]. The flask is filled with 300 ml methanol for the methanolic extract and 300 ml ethanol for the ethanolic extract, and the flask is placed on a heater. When heated, the solvent evaporates, condenses in the cooler, falls back into the Soxhlet extractor, solubilizes the active ingredients, and returns to the recovery flask: the operation is repeated several times for 6 hours until the powder is completely depleted. The extract solution is cooled to room temperature, filtered through a filter paper, and then freed of all traces of solvent by means of a rotary vacuum evaporator at 40°C.
